pli-tv-bu-vb-as1:1.1.pli: Ime kho panāyasmanto satta adhikaraṇasamathā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-as1:1.1.eng: “Venerables, these seven principles for the settling of legal issues come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-as1:2.1.eng: For the settling and resolving of legal issues whenever they arise there is:

pli-tv-bu-vb-as2:1.1.eng: Resolution through recollection to be granted;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as3:1.1.eng: Resolution because of past insanity to be granted;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as4:1.1.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:1.1.eng: Covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:2.1.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, āyasmanto, satta adhikaraṇasamathā dhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:2.1.eng: Venerables, the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited.

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:2.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:2.8.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:3.1.eng: The seven principles for the settling of legal issues are finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.2.eng: the four rules on expulsion have been recited;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.3.eng: the thirteen rules on suspension have been recited;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.4.eng: the two undetermined rules have been recited;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.5.eng: the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.6.eng: the ninety-two rules on confession have been recited;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.7.eng: the four rules on acknowledgment have been recited;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.8.eng: the rules to be trained in have been recited;

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.9.eng: the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited.

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.10.pli: Ettakaṃ tassa bhagavato suttāgataṃ suttapariyāpannaṃ anvaddhamāsaṃ uddesaṃ āgacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.10.eng: This much has come down and is included in the Monastic Code of the Buddha and comes up for recitation every half-month.

pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.11.pli: Tattha sabbeheva samaggehi sammodamānehi avivadamānehi sikkhitabbanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-as7:4.11.eng: In regard to this everyone should train in unity, in concord, without dispute.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:0.5.pli: Ime kho panāyasmanto dve aniyatā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:0.5.eng: Venerables, these two undetermined rules come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī sāvatthiyaṃ kulūpako hoti, bahukāni kulāni upasaṅkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato udāyissa upaṭṭhākakulassa kumārikā aññatarassa kulassa kumārakassa dinnā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.3.eng: On one occasion one of the families that supported him gave their daughter in marriage to the son of another family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā manusse pucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.4.eng: Soon afterwards Venerable Udāyī robed up in the morning, took his bowl and robe, and went to the first of those families. When he arrived, he asked

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.7.eng: that she had been given to another family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.8.pli: Tampi kho kulaṃ āyasmato udāyissa upaṭṭhākaṃ hoti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā manusse pucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.9.eng: He then went there and again asked

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.13.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā kumārikā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tassā kumārikāya saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappesi kālayuttaṃ samullapanto kālayuttaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇanto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.13.eng: He went up to that girl, and the two of them sat down alone in private on a concealed seat suitable for the deed. When they were able, they chatted; otherwise he gave her a teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.13.comm: Sp 1.443: Tattha kālayuttaṁ samullapantoti kālaṁ sallakkhetvā yadā na añño koci samīpena gacchati vā āgacchati vā tadā tadanurūpaṁ “kacci na ukkaṇṭhasi, na kilamasi, na chātāsī”tiādikaṁ gehassitaṁ kathaṁ kathento, “‘When they were able, they chatted’: having considered the occasion, whether anyone else was coming or going nearby, they spoke about worldly things, such as, ‘I hope you are not yearning, fed up, and craving.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.14.pli: Tena kho pana samayena visākhā migāramātā bahuputtā hoti bahunattā arogaputtā aroganattā abhimaṅgalasammatā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.14.eng: At that time Visākhā Migāramātā had many healthy children and grandchildren. As a consequence, she was considered auspicious.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.15.pli: Manussā yaññesu chaṇesu ussavesu visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ paṭhamaṃ bhojenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.15.eng: At sacrifices, ceremonies, and celebrations people would feed Visākhā first.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.16.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā nimantitā taṃ kulaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.16.eng: Just then she had been invited to that family that supported Udāyī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.17.pli: Addasā kho visākhā migāramātā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ tassā kumārikāya saddhiṃ ekaṃ ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisinnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.17.eng: When she arrived, she saw him sitting alone with that girl,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.19.pli: “idaṃ, bhante, nacchannaṃ nappatirūpaṃ yaṃ ayyo mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.19.eng: “Venerable, it’s not appropriate for you to sit down in private alone with a woman on a concealed seat suitable for the deed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.20.pli: Kiñcāpi, bhante, ayyo anatthiko tena dhammena, api ca dussaddhāpayā appasannā manussā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.20.eng: You may not be aiming at that act, but it’s hard to convince people with little confidence.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.21.pli: Evampi kho āyasmā udāyī visākhāya migāramātuyā vuccamāno nādiyi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.22.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā nikkhamitvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.22.eng: After leaving, Visākhā told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.23.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.23.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.24.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.24.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī sit down in private alone with a woman on a concealed seat suitable for the deed?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.25.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.25.eng: After rebuking Udāyī in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.26.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.26.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.29.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.29.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.31.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.31.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.32.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappeyya, tamenaṃ saddheyyavacasā upāsikā disvā
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.32.1.eng: ‘If a monk sits down in private alone with a woman on a concealed seat suitable for the deed, and a trustworthy female lay follower sees him

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.33.pli: tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya—pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.33.eng: and accuses him of an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, or an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.34.pli: Nisajjaṃ bhikkhu paṭijānamāno tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena kāretabbo—pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.34.eng: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these three

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.35.pli: Yena vā sā saddheyyavacasā upāsikā vadeyya, tena so bhikkhu kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.35.eng: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.6.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī na petī na tiracchānagatā. Antamaso tadahujātāpi dārikā, pageva mahattarī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.6.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; even a girl born that very day, let alone an older one.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.10.eng: just the monk and the woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.12.eng: private to the eye and private to the ear.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.14.pli: na sakkā hoti akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇīyamāne bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne sīsaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne passituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.14.eng: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.16.eng: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.18.pli: āsanaṃ kuṭṭena vā kavāṭena vā kilañjena vā sāṇipākārena vā rukkhena vā thambhena vā kotthaḷiyā vā yena kenaci paṭicchannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.18.eng: it is concealed by a wall, a screen, a door, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.20.eng: one is able to have sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.22.pli: mātugāme nisinne bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.22.eng: the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.23.pli: Bhikkhu nisinne mātugāmo upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.23.eng: The woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.24.pli: Ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.24.eng: Both are seated or both are lying down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.26.eng: she has attained the fruit, she has broken through, she has understood the instruction.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.28.pli: buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.1.28.eng: she has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.1.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena vadeyya— pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.1.eng: If she accuses him of an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, or an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.2.pli: Nisajjaṃ bhikkhu paṭijānamāno tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ aññatarena kāretabbo— pārājikena vā saṅghādisesena vā pācittiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.2.eng: then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with according to one of these three

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.3.pli: Yena vā sā saddheyyavacasā upāsikā vadeyya tena so bhikkhu kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.3.eng: or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.4.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.5.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nisinno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.5.eng: “I’ve seen you seated, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.6.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.6.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.7.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.8.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nisinno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.8.eng: “I’ve seen you seated, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.10.pli: “saccāhaṃ nisinno, no ca kho methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevin”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.10.eng: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t have sexual intercourse,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.11.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.12.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.13.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nisinno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.13.eng: “I’ve seen you seated, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.16.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.17.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.18.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nisinno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.18.eng: “I’ve seen you seated, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.21.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.22.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.23.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nipanno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.23.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.24.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.24.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.25.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.26.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nipanno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.26.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.28.pli: “saccāhaṃ nipanno, no ca kho methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevin”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.28.eng: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t have sexual intercourse,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.29.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.30.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.31.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nipanno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.31.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.34.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.35.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.36.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nipanno mātugāmassa methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.36.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down, having sexual intercourse with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.39.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.40.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.41.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nisinno mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.41.eng: “I’ve seen you seated, making physical contact with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.42.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.42.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.43.pli: “saccāhaṃ nisinno no ca kho kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjin”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.43.eng: “It’s true that I was seated, but I didn’t make physical contact,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.44.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.46.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.48.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.49.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.50.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho nipanno mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanto”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.50.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down, making physical contact with a woman,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.51.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.51.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the offense. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.52.pli: “saccāhaṃ nipanno, no ca kho kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjin”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.52.eng: “It’s true that I was lying down, but I didn’t make physical contact,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.53.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.55.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.57.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.58.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.59.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisinno”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.59.eng: “I’ve seen you seated in private alone with a woman on a concealed seat suitable for the deed,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.60.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, nisajjāya kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.60.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.62.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.64.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.65.eng: If she accuses him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.66.pli: “ayyo mayā diṭṭho mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nipanno”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.66.eng: “I’ve seen you lying down in private alone with a woman on a concealed seat suitable for the deed,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.67.pli: so ca taṃ paṭijānāti, nipajjāya kāretabbo …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.67.eng: and he admits to that, then he is to be dealt with for the lying down. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.69.eng: then he is to be dealt with for the sitting. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.71.eng: then he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.73.pli: na niyato, pārājikaṃ vā saṅghādiseso vā pācittiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:2.2.73.eng: not determined. It is either an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, or an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.1.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.1.eng: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.2.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.2.eng: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, yet he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.3.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjāya kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.3.eng: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, but he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.4.pli: Gamanaṃ paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, na kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.4.eng: If he admits to going, but he does not admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.5.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.5.eng: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.6.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiyā kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.6.eng: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, but he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.7.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjāya kāretabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.7.eng: If he does not admit to going, but he admits to sitting, yet he does not admit to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the sitting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.8.pli: Gamanaṃ na paṭijānāti, nisajjaṃ na paṭijānāti, āpattiṃ na paṭijānāti, na kāretabboti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.8.eng: If he does not admit to going, nor does he admit to sitting, nor does he admit to an offense, he is not to be dealt with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.9.eng: The first undetermined offense is finished.
